item.title: Rupee ends a tad lower on dollar bids from importers, foreign banks

review.headline_rewrite: Rupee ends a tad lower on dollar bids from importers, foreign banks
bullets: By Jaspreet Kalra MUMBAI, September 04 (Reuters) - The Indian rupee ended modestly lower on Thursday as dollar demand from local oil companies and
The rupee closed at 88.1450 against the U.S.
The absence of chunky outflows from local stocks has helped the currency stay steady after hitting a record low of 88.33 on September 1,
India's benchmark equity indexes, the BSE Sensex and Nifty 50 ended slightly higher, helped by the government lowering consumption taxes to revive local demand
